1.text: Microwave chocolate chips at 30- and 15-second intervals until they’re melted.

2.text: Spread the melted chocolate in a silicone mold.

3.text: Refrigerate the melted chocolate until it hardens.

4.text: Remove the hardened chocolate shells gently from the mold.

5.text: Spoon hot chocolate mix and toppings into one hardened chocolate shell.

6.text: Heat a plate in the microwave for around 1 minute.

7.text: Rub the edge of a new chocolate shell on the warm surface so it’s slightly soft.

8.text: Place the softened chocolate shell on top of the filled shell.

9.text: Drizzle melted chocolate over the bomb for decoration.

10.text: Store your hot chocolate bombs in a sealed container in a cool space.

11.text: Place a hot chocolate bomb in an empty mug.

12.text: Microwave 8  fl oz (240 mL) of milk in 15-second intervals.

13.text: Pour the hot milk into the mug.

14.text: Stir the bomb until the chocolate and cocoa mix dissolves.
